results.title: Alcohol and the human body
results.brief_description: Explains the source of alcohol in liquours produced by fermentation from wheat, grapes, corn and other plants. Diagrams show what happens to alcohol in the human body, how it deadens the judgement centres, affects the vision, slows up muscle responsivenss and may result in unconsciousness. The problem drunkard is diagnosed as a sick person requiring medical treatment. Alcohol is shown to be a social problem as well as a personal health issue.

results.title: Alcohol and drugs in the workplace
results.brief_description: An information and training video and accompanying trainer’s manual about alcohol and drug use in the workplace. Contrary to the popular perception that people with alcohol or other drug related problems are unemployed or disenfranchised, 60-70% are in full-time employment. Of all workplace accidents 20-30% involve people in an intoxicated state. This video aims to demonstrate the extent of the cost, both to industry and the individual, of drug and alcohol use in the workplace. It deals with the responsibilities of industry and co-workers, and outlines employee assistance programs that will help those suffering from dependency problems.

results.title: Alcohol
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”.
This film shows alcohol as a mood changing substance. It shows the effects of different levels of alcohol consumption, which can lead to coma and death in extreme cases. The film stresses that decisions to use alcohol are best left to the informed individual. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Alcheringa
results.brief_description: An Australian Broadcasting Commission television program of twelve 15 minute episodes initially broadcast weekly, that re-created, an imagined world of everyday Indigenous practices before the coming of the Europeans.

constellations_other.name: Setting the record straight
constellations_other.description: For too long, the history of Australia was only told in mainstream films through a white lens. First Nations people have used the camera as a means of truth-telling and setting the record straight for decades.

results.title: Albury: year round holiday centre
results.brief_description: A look at Albury, holiday and convention city, and its surrounding resorts. Shows the numerous amenities they can offer to the tourist or visitor. Points of interest seen are Lake Hume, Beechworth and its historic buildings and Mount Beauty and skiing at Falls Creek. No further credits available.
